intro: Trigonotis hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Trigonotis hookeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
